message: I actually did not test for speed at all (yet). In my case, I'm looking at using a cache in Event Sourcing, where missing the cache is much more significant.

Excellent information, thanks Stephen! With cache being relatively expensive and billed based on size, it makes sense to pick the most compact serializer out of the gate. I'm sure that most cache operations are much faster than their database or service counterparts -- that is their whole purpose, after all -- but I can't help wondering if there's a significant size/speed trade-off between them all. You hinted at it a bit with BSON vs JSON; any insights or too soon to tell?
Thanks for the article Stephen. Very curious to see the speed test results.

Thanks for the article!  
Any update on speed or event sourcing?
MS is known for there slow JavaScript serializer. So would love to see some speed tests.
The new Microsoft templates all use JSON.NET, as does my code.

The Azure cache always serializes because it is a distributed cache.  

I don't know of any comparisons with ProtoBuf.Net, sorry.

Hi, Very good article. Have few questions  
1. will Azure Cache Service do serialize/deserialize by default?  
2. Is there any comparison with ProtoBuf.Net serializer?  

Thanks  
Suresh

Very nice and useful example. I added Stopwatch timing to compare speed. Results:

Default:  
47616 ticks (ser)  
517 bytes  
3169 ticks (de)

Default (compressed):  
2397 ticks (ser)  
317 bytes  
267 ticks (de)

Default (serializable):  
2686 ticks (ser)  
691 bytes  
2293 ticks (de)

Default (serializable, compressed):  
285 ticks (ser)  
343 bytes  
168 ticks (de)

Binary:  
144 ticks (ser)  
321 bytes  
348 ticks (de)

Binary (compressed):  
479 ticks (ser)  
233 bytes  
186 ticks (de)

JSON:  
241801 ticks (ser)  
185 bytes  
108606 ticks (de)

JSON (compressed):  
447 ticks (ser)  
142 bytes  
659 ticks (de)

BSON:  
18804 ticks (ser)  
193 bytes  
13461 ticks (de)

BSON (compressed):  
377 ticks (ser)  
153 bytes  
124 ticks (de)
